Problem involves calculating gravitational force exerted by remaining part of sphere after removing smaller sphere.
Identify given values: Mass of original sphere M = M1, Radius of original sphere R, Mass of point mass m, Distance from center of sphere to point mass 2R.
Calculate gravitational force exerted by original sphere on point mass: F = GM1m/(2R)^2.
Calculate mass of sphere removed: M2 = M - m.
Calculate gravitational force exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass: F = GM2m/R^2.
Substitute M2 = M - m into equation: F = M(m - m)/R^2 = M/R^2.
Since force exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass is same as force exerted by original sphere, final answer is F = M/R^2.
